content: Anyone have experience with D7 Features module? I'm looking to migrate a D7 site that has a few custom Features and I want to get rid of Features and its dependencies, but keep the functionality (views, content types, settings, etc.)...

@BWPanda there is this: https://www.drupal.org/project/unfeaturize
@jenlampton also wrote a blog post / gave a presentation on what you're asking for, but I cannot locate it.
Yeah I found that, but it seems to only refer to content types... My features have all sorts of stuff.
I think it'll probably just be easier to setup a new Backdrop site from scratch and migrate things manually... (for this site anyway)

As long as all the things in your feature are in the database (and not only in code) an upgrade from Drupal 7 should work normally. I usually just disable my feature modules in D7 and confirm everything is still there... then, update.php!

BWPanda said:

Yeah I found that, but it seems to only refer to content types... My features have all sorts of stuff.

Feeds!!! I'm thinking at one point I should (we should as a group) write an article on when to upgrade vs. migrate using Feeds.

Yep. This site has ~700 'Product' nodes which were/are imported from the client's SAGE database using a CSV file and Feeds in D7. So we're just going to use Feeds for them in Backdrop too. The rest of the site consists of about 5 other nodes, which I'll just copy over by hand :smile:

The Unfeaturize module was mentioned in https://api.backdropcms.org/documentation/upgrading-from-drupal-7. I just linkified the mention to it, so it'd be easier for people to know what we are talking about.
I finally remembered where I had seen Jen's presentation on sites w/o Features and found it: YouTube - DrupalCon Seattle 2019: A world without features - save time by managing exportables
Okay, I just went and re-watched/listened to it, and it doesn't apply to @BWPanda's situation, like I thought it did.
maybe we should create a Features Converter module for upgrades.
